description: {"blocks":[{"key":"44hhk","text":"Nematode migration, feeding site formation, withdrawal of plant assimilates and activation of plant defence responses have a significant impact on plant growth and development. Plants display intraspecific variation in tolerance limits for root-feeding nematodes. Although disease tolerance has been recognised as a distinct trait in biotic interactions of mainly crops, we lack mechanistic insights. Progress is hampered by difficulties in quantification and laborious screening methods. We turned to the model plant Arabidopsis thaliana, since it offers extensive resources to study the molecular and cellular mechanisms underlying nematode-plant interactions. We established through imaging of tolerance-related parameters that green canopy area was an accessible and robust measure for assessing damage as the consequence of cyst nematode infection. Subsequently, we developed a high-throughput phenotyping platform to non-destructively measure the green canopy area growth of 960 A. thaliana plants simultaneously.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":518,"length":20},{"style":"italic","offset":985,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

keywords: High-throughput phenotyping, Arabidopsis, green canopy area, nematodes
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"cmsjb","text":"200mL pots","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"clru4","text":"Silversand","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7f0c8","text":"3 mm thick black nonreflective foamed PVC coversheet ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ds4q0","text":"Hyponex: (1.7 mM/L NH4+, 4.1 mM/L K+, 2 mM/L Ca2+, 1.2 mM/L Mg2+, 4.3 mM/L NO3-, 3.3 mM/L SO42-, 1.3 mM/L H2PO4-, 3.4 µm/L Mn, 4.7 µm/L Zn, B 14 µm/L, 6.9 µm/L Cu, 0.5 µm/L Mo, 21 µm/L Fe, pH 5.8)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":22,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":35,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":48,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":63,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":78,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":93,"length":2},{"style":"sup","offset":111,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":47,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":62,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":77,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":92,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":110,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"69okv","text":"UI-1490LE-C-HQ cameras (IDS Imaging) mounted with 12mm lenses (Cat. No. B5M12056, IDS Imaging)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"63s8h","text":"Once all the pots are filled with silversand, cover them with the black nonreflective foamed PVC coversheet. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"80f7o","text":"Sow 2 to 5 Arabidopsis seeds per pot using a toothpick.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d641k","text":"Prior to sowing, silver sand was watered with Hyponex for five minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5o1dq","text":"Seven days after sowing, remove redundant seedlings were using a tweezer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8gvn1","text":"At eight days after sowing, water the plants with Hyponex for five minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"cnvno","text":"Inoculate the seedlings with nematode at nine days after sowing","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b2508","text":"After inoculation, start the camera system to take pictures of the Arabidopsis seedlings (15 pictures per day with an hour interval for a period 23 days).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dk183","text":"Finally, the surface area of the rosette was determined using a custom-written ImageJ macro (ImageJ 1.51f; Java 1.8.0_321 [32-bit]) and Java was used to make GIFs.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
